clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound-guided Continuous Adductor Canal Block for Analgesia After Total Knee Replacement: Comparison of Short-axis and Long-axis Techniques

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares the long-axis and short-axis technique of continues adductor canal block for total knee replacement surgery. Half participants will receive long-axis catheterization, while the other half will receive short-axis catheterization.

study_design_info.masking: Double Blind (Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: strength of quadriceps femoris measured on a Lovett muscle strength rating-scale 48 hours after surgery

secondary_outcome.description: use the self-assessment 11item QoR scale to assess the patient's recovery quality,SAX-group vs. LAX-group
Record complications including catheter dislodgment, puncture point infection, leakage,falling down,et al.
Pain-score measured on a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) .SAX-group vs. LAX-group

arm_group.arm_group_label: short axis (SAX) placement of adductor canal catheters
arm_group.description: Procedure: Ultrasound guided short axis (SAX) placement of adductor canal catheters Philip CX50 ultrasound scanner guided insertion of a PAJUNK Contiplex S catheter along the short axis of the middle part of adductor canal

arm_group.arm_group_label: long axis (LAX) placement of adductor canal catheters
arm_group.description: Procedure: Ultrasound guided long axis (LAX) placement of adductor canal catheters Philip CX50 ultrasound scanner guided insertion of a catheter along the long axis of the middle part of adductor canal

intervention.intervention_name: ultrasound guided long axis placement of adductor canal catheter
intervention.description: The long axis of the ultrasound probe is placed parallel to the long axis of the adductor canal while scanning, and the catheter is placed along the long axis of the canal using an in-plane approach
intervention.arm_group_label: long axis (LAX) placement of adductor canal catheters

intervention.intervention_name: ultrasound guided short axis placement of adductor canal catheter
intervention.description: The long axis of the ultrasound probe is placed vertical to the long axis of the adductor canal while scanning, and the catheter is placed along the short axis of the canal using an in-plane approach
intervention.arm_group_label: short axis (SAX) placement of adductor canal catheters

intervention.description: The linear (C5-12) probe of Philip CX 50 Ultrasound Scanner is used for scanning

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-80 years
- Knee-arthroscopy
- Written consent
- ASA I-III
- BMI 19-35
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to communicate in Danish
- Allergic reactions toward drugs used in the trial
- Pregnancy
- Abuse of alcohol/drugs
- Daily opioid intake
- Infection at injection site
- Can not be mobilised to 5 meters of walk; pre-surgery
